item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Desmond Tutu (Foreword)
item.description: "If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse, and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality." -- Desmond Tutu (Foreword)

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
item.description: "People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within." -- Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Leo Buscaglia
item.description: "Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around." -- Leo Buscaglia

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Rabbi Roy Walter
item.description: "We never question whether something is fair when it's good. But when something bad happens, the first thing we say is, "This isn’t fair." -- Rabbi Roy Walter

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "Life is 10 percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Maria Robinson
item.description: "Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending." -- Maria Robinson

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "There are moments when everything goes well; don't be frightened, it won't last." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Paul Johannes Tillich
item.description:
"Grace strikes us when we are in great pain and restlessness. . . .Sometimes at that moment a wave of light breaks into our darkness, and it is as though a voice were saying: You are accepted.
" -- Paul Johannes Tillich

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Out of clutter, find simplicity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Mary Angel add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky
